subject: p16855430
History: Shortness of breath with ambulation in a patient with diastolic congestive heart failure and chronic kidney disease, presenting with urinary tract infection.
Findings: PA and lateral views of the chest were obtained. As compared to the prior study performed, the lung volumes have increased which probably reflects better inspiration. There is unchanged moderate cardiomegaly with an unchanged left pleural effusion and left lower lobe atelectasis. The opacities on the right persist, and the vascular diameters have decreased but have still not returned to normal. There is no pneumothorax. The bones and soft tissues are unremarkable.
Impression: Compared to the study, there has been mild improvement but not complete resolution of the pre-existing pulmonary edema, left pleural effusion with atelectasis, and cardiomegaly.
